The nation could not but know, could not but take great notice of, the times so exactly set out by the angel Gabriel. Since, therefore, the coming of the Messias was the great wish and desire of all,—and since the time of his appearing was so clearly decreed by the angel that nothing could be more,—and when the latter half of the last seven years, chiefly to be observed, was now, within a very little, come ;- 11 is no wonder if the people, hearing from this venerable preacher that the kingdom of heaven was now come, should be stirred up beyond measure to meet him, and should flock to him.
